com.sri.kernel.comm
Class CommServer

java.lang.Object
  com.sri.common.net.DefaultSRISocketReader
      com.sri.kernel.comm.CommServer
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable, SRISocketReader
public class CommServer
extends DefaultSRISocketReader
implements java.lang.Runnable

This is the kernels implementation of the SRTP protocol. SRTP, or Smart Robots Transfer Protocol, is the method in which the robot receives and sends communication over the network. SRTP resembles the HTTP protocol in that it is composed of a header and content, with the header being a description of the content.

This class acts as an SRTP server, providing a mechanism for SRTP clients to connect and communicate with the SR4 Kernel.

Version:
1.5
Author:
Joseph Monti, Smart Robots

Constructor Detail

CommServer

public CommServer(SR4Kernel kernel)
Creates a new CommServer with the provided kernel. This will get needed configuration options and start a new execution thread for accepting clients.

Parameters:
kernel - The SR4Kernel with which to initialize.

readModule

public void readModule(SRISocket socket,
                       java.lang.String moduleName,
                       byte[] bytes)
This will read a module, save it to the filesystem, and load the module. If a module of the same name exists, the existing module will be unloaded if needed and removed from the module list before the new module is loaded. There is no mechanism to prevent a module from being replaced with a module from this method. The module will be saved in the module directory with the name [moduleName].jar

Specified by:
readModule in interface SRISocketReader
Overrides:
readModule in class DefaultSRISocketReader
Parameters:
socket - The recieving socket used to return communication.
moduleName - The name of the module.
bytes - The bytes which make up the module.

run

public void run()
This method accepts new incoming connections. When a connection is accepted it will create a new SRISocket for the socket, add it to its list of clients, and log the new connection.

Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable
